group_1.textCenter: Well, everyone, that's it for today.@Take care on your way home.
Festival Committee members, please hang back@for a meeting later.
Alright then, class is finished. Dismissed.
(Everywhere you look, it's all about the Festival.)

group_1.textRight: Good work, Miura.@You were as cool as ever today.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks again for the other day, Miura.
Haitani, Kuroda.@What are you thanking me for?

group_1.textRight: It's for the deer meat you gave me the other day.@My old man was thrilled about how tasty it was.

group_1.textLeft: You seemed worn out at the time, Kuroda.
I just thought that food might help improve@your spirits...

group_1.textRight: I'm really sorry for inconveniencing you...

group_1.textLeft: When you bow to me like that, it makes me@feel compelled to reciprocate in kind.
By the way, Haitani, are you here about the@same thing?

group_1.textRight: Actually, Miura, I was hoping to share an article@about something with you.
Here, this is a web article for the local magazine.

group_1.narration: "A stone monument discovered in the@mountains of the Toki Village could support the@Fugitive Heike Clan Legend, which has long@been said to have no related evidence."

group_1.textLeft: No way, is this really the stone monument I@discovered a while back?!

group_1.textRight: Yeah, it looks like the Board of Education got@jurisdiction and will be investigating from here on.

group_1.textLeft: *Sigh*... I never expected something like this@to happen...

group_1.textRight: Thanks to this, Kuroda and I are going to be@swamped with work on the Festival's Committee.
After all, our school plans to have an exhibition@on Yukuni's history, you see.

group_1.textLeft: Was the meeting the teacher announced about@the stone monument...?
I'm sorry for adding to your workload.

group_1.textRight: I was just thinking what a shame it was that@there was no evidence
to back up such an interesting story as the@Fugitive Heike Clan Legend.
"Without any elements lending to its credibility,@it might as well be non-existent."
So, honestly? Thanks a lot for finding it for us.
I appreciate you keeping me busy, too.
Being busy like this helps me put the avalanche@out of my mind.

group_1.textLeft: I'd prefer if you didn't smile when you say things@that are hard to reply to...

group_1.textRight: My bad, I see you've got stuff going on too, Miura.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, it's nothing of any particular importance.
Both of you on the Festival's Executive Committee@are certainly doing your best, too.
